title: 8-year-old, 2 adults injured during drive-by shooting in North Miami
content:
NORTH MIAMI, Fla. - Three people, including an 8-year-old, were injured Wednesday night during a drive-by shooting in North Miami, police said.
The shooting occurred about 9:45 p.m. in the 1200 block of Northeast 128th Street.
"A family was gathered right outside their apartment when a vehicle drove by and multiple shots were fired," North Miami police Cmdr. Rafael Estrugo said.
The victims of the shooting were an 8-year-old boy, an 18-year-old man and a 35-year-old woman.
A neighbor said she heard about five or six gunshots and then saw police quickly converge on the scene. Another neighbor said the 8-year-old boy and his family recently arrived to the United States from Haiti.
The victims were taken to local hospitals with non-life-threatening injuries.
